title: Ranjith Aluwihare resigns from SJB
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Deputy National Organiser Ranjith Aluwihare has resigned from his post. Aluwihare told the media that he had resigned from the post.

title: Six police officers who assaulted a youth ordered to pay Rs. 1.2 million compensation
byline: The Supreme Court (SC) ruled that six former officers of the Thambuttegama Police must personally pay Rs. 1.2 million compensation for violating the fundamental rights of a youth who was arrested, brutally assaulted, and tortured after participating in a 2012 protest march against the police.

title: PM assures no land acquisition in North and East, vows to restore ownership
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya affirmed today that the government has no intention of acquiring lands owned by residents of the Northern and Eastern provinces and is fully committed to restoring land ownership to rightful owners without delay.

title: Cinchona, a plant species with medicinal properties for Malaria
byline: Several well-grown cinchona plants belonging to a plant species considered extinct in Sri Lanka have been found after 150 years in Unanagala in the western slopes of Aliyagala Mountain Range in Ambagamuwa.

title: EU calls for ’respect’ after Trump threatens 50% tariffs
byline: The European Union’s trade chief said the 27-member bloc is committed to securing a trade deal with the US based on ’’respect’’ not ’’threats’’.

title: Ukraine and Russia take part in biggest prisoner swap since 2022 invasion
byline: Russia and Ukraine have each handed over 390 soldiers and civilians in the biggest prisoner exchange since the start of the full-scale Russian invasion in 2022.

title: At least 23 injured after private bus overturns near Nuwara Eliya
byline: At least 23 people were injured in a late-night accident in the Toppass area along the Nuwara Eliya–Kandy main road, when a private bus overturned around 11:45 p.m., police said.

title: SLTB bus-tipper collision in Weliara leaves one dead, 13 injured
byline: A road accident occurred in the early hours of this morning along the Colombo–Wellawaya main road in the Weliara area, resulting in one fatality and 13 injuries.

title: Sri Lanka’s largest tourism exhibition Sancharaka Udawa 2025 kicks off in Colombo
byline: Sri Lanka’s largest tourism exhibition Sancharaka Udawa 2025 kicked off in Colombo, under the patronage of President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Vetran Actress Malini Fonseka passes away
byline: Vetran actress Malini Fonseka, who had become a household name in Sri Lanka, passed away at the age of 78.

title: Germany to press Sri Lanka on PTA repeal during President visit
byline: Germany will ask President Anura Kumara Dissanayake about steps being taken by his government for the repeal of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA), reconciliation and addressing wartime accountability issues during his upcoming visit there, the Daily Mirror has learnt.

title: National SME Forum 2025 opens new doors to global markets and growth opportunities
byline: National SME Forum 2025, organised by The Ceylon Chamber of Commerce, this week brought together over 200 small and medium enterprises (SMEs) from across Sri Lanka,

title: IMF ties SL board review to electricity tariffs, financing commitments
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) said the timing of its Executive Board meeting to approve Sri Lanka’s next tranche of funding, under the Extended Fund Facility, would depend on the government’s ability to deliver on key reform commitments, including the electricity tariff adjustments.

title: ‘SL a five-star island with three-star image’: Veteran hotelier calls for tourism reset
byline: Veteran hotelier Hiran Cooray on Thursday called on Sri Lanka’s tourism industry to raise its standards, urging a shift from what he described as a “three-star mentality” to one that reflects the country’s “five-star” potential.
